summary:
Economist (PhD) with a strong background in management and mathematics (Operations Research), specialized in institutional and production economics for smallholder agriculture and agro-food enterprises in developing countries. Over 25 years of professional expertise. More than 15 years of hands-on experience in training, action-research and participatory extension and development in sub-Saharan Africa. Extensive experience in assessing and addressing organizational and institutional issues related to technological innovation, agribusiness cluster formation and commodity value chain development, and integration of smallholder farmers and local entrepreneurs in markets. Trainer and facilitator of multi-stakeholder platforms and (social) learning and negotiation processes. Team leader and coach of complex projects, multi-disciplinary teams and multi-stakeholder networks.

Specialties: Agribusiness development, value chain analysis, (institutional) economics, financing systems, communication for rural innovation, empowerment, facilitation and adult learning (incl. Training-of-Trainer), project cycle management and monitoring and evaluation.

profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
2SCALE is a five year Dutch Government initiative which seeks to improve rural livelihoods and nutrition security in Africa by integrating about 1 million smallholder farmers in national and regional value chains in sub-Saharan Africa. The aim of the program is to promote local production for local, including Base-of-the-Pyramid, markets. The project is implemented by a consortium of partners, i.e., IFDC, ICRA and BoP Innovation Center. The program works in nine target countries, i.e., Benin, Ghana, Mali and Nigeria in West Africa, and Ethiopia, Kenya, Mozambique, South Sudan and Uganda in east and Southern Africa.

As Chief of Party, I am supposed to provide vision and leadership, to develop and implement  partnership strategies in support of inclusive business, to manage field teams, to maintain relationships with donors, between consortium partners, and to ensure effective communication.
profile_positions.title: Chief of Party 2SCALE

profile_positions.description:
ICRA is an International Organization, with roots in the European landscape, established to strengthen capacities of professionals in facilitating agricultural and rural change, through research and innovation. 
 
As Director of ICRA, I was responsible for strategic direction & vision; for program management and coaching of staff; for development of new products, approaches and projects; for financial sustainability and for representation / networking. 

Under my responsibility ICRA expanded its portfolio of projects and developed its training program in four specific domains: agricultural research for development, higher education outreach, advisory services, and agribusiness coaching.
profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description: As Deputy Director, I was responsible for overseeing ICRA’s partnerships on Agricultural Research for Development in the South, fostering internal and external learning and exchange, and providing input for the strategic orientation of ICRA as a facilitating and capacity building organization.

company.name: IFDC International Centre for Soil Fertility Management and Agricultural Development

profile_positions.description:
“From Thousands to Millions”, or 1000s+, was a collaborative regional program fostering agricultural intensification and market development in West Africa. The 1000s+ program was pioneering the development of the CASE (Competitive Agricultural Systems and Enterprises) approach – developed by IFDC – at a large scale, using innovative action-research, brokering, empowerment, capacity-building and training approaches.

As Chief of Party I was responsible for strategic direction & vision; for donor contacts (e.g., DGIS/ The Netherlands, USAID, IFA), reporting, and supervision and coaching of a multi-disciplinary project team (20 staff members, mainly national positions) based in Benin, Burkina Faso, Mali, Niger, Nigeria and Togo.
profile_positions.title: Chief of Party 1000s+ and Resident Representative (Mali Office)

company.name: IFDC International Centre for Soil Fertility Management and Agriculture

profile_positions.company: IFDC International Centre for Soil Fertility Management and Agriculture
profile_positions.description:
As Program Leader I provided supervision and coaching to interdisciplinary teams based in various locations in Central and West Africa and implementing a variety of projects and training programs related to agricultural intensification, and commodity-chain and market development. I coordinated several regional-level projects, including the “Farmers for the Future” project financed by USAID and the “Fertilizers and Sustainable Agricultural Development” project financed by the International Fertilizer Industry Association (IFA). I was also team leader for IFDC’s input to PRODEPAM (Programme de Développement de la Production Agricole au Mali), a large USAID/ Mali financed project, focusing on irrigated crop and animal feed production. 

During this period we also developed the CASE (Competitive Agricultural Systems and Enterprises) approach – inspired by Porters’ analysis of competitive advantages of nations (industry clusters) and new institutional economics – implemented by IFDC and partner institutions in an effort to facilitate sustainable agricultural development. We also initiated a community of practice, called the “Agricultural Intensification in Sub-Saharan Africa” (AISSA) network.
profile_positions.title: Program Leader

profile_positions.location: Groningen, The Netherlands & Tougan, Burkina Faso
profile_positions.description:
Carried out research and prepared reports for several international inter-university and inter-institutional research networks, comprising the AGRISK program on Risks in Food Production (collaboration between University of Groningen and Ouagadougou) and the SADAOC (‘Sécurité Alimentaire Durable en Afrique de l’Ouest Centrale’) network, an international network of researchers and policy-makers on food security and food policies, in which several universities and research institutions from Ghana, Togo, Mali, Benin, Burkina Faso, and Côte d’Ivoire participate. I also coordinated an inter-university study-group on risks and risk-minimizing food security strategies in rural areas in developing countries in the Netherlands.

In Burkina Faso (1992 – 1996), I was coach of a multi-disciplinary research team in charge of agricultural and environmental research in the North-western region of Burkina Faso. Implemented and coordinated research on farmers’ strategies, land tenure aspects, natural resource management, indigenous knowledge, and competitiveness of, among others, irrigated and lowland rice growing, cereal/ legume inter-cropping systems, livestock and animal feed production. Responsible for the introduction of participatory methods for research on food security strategies, at household and regional levels. The program involved national (both from INERA and the University of Ouagadougou) and international researchers. I also coordinated food security and farming systems research activities of the SADAOC network in Burkina Faso and Ghana.
profile_positions.title: Researcher
